title: Donald Duck Comics Fonts
content:
Which fonts are used for the Dutch Donald Duck comics?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140403230551im_/http:/typophile.com/files/e0b35e10863cc5f930f2c518d97c307f_6138.151099.jpeg)

Thanks in advance! :)

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel
author: Martijn van Berkel

comments.content:
1: Most probably an hand drawn logo.  
2: Have you checked the “usual suspects”?  
 [http://www.comicbookfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140403230551/http:/www.comicbookfonts.com/ "http://www.comicbookfonts.com/")  
 [http://www.blambot.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140403230551/http:/www.blambot.com/ "http://www.blambot.com/")

Couldn't find them in the sections where you would look for that style.

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel

The logo was hand lettered by Disney cartoonist Carl Barks:

[http://www.cbarks.dk/thelogos.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140403230551/http:/www.cbarks.dk/thelogos.htm "http://www.cbarks.dk/thelogos.htm")
